intro: Chamaesyce rutilis, commonly known as the golden sandweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in xeriscaping and as a ornamental plant in gardens.
